column4: i aslo have issue with ssh, i want to log on with out placing a password. but it keeps asking for one. sudo ssh -l root 192.168.1.7 whoami
root@192.168.1.7's password:
you enabled root's password?
i edited ssh_config and set it to permit root logon
And you unlocked the root account?
I strongly suggest not doing that.
i really need two
What are you looking for it to do? not ask for the password at all?
im using backuppc. it needs to log on and run a buckup.
why are you running sudo before ssh?
i need to to work with out asking for a password, ssh -l root 192.168.1.7 whoami
And without using keyfiles?
yep i have exchanged the keys. i done as instructed here. http://backuppc.sourceforge.net/faq/ssh.html
Does it prompt you for a password if you just use `ssh root@address` and not `sudo ssh root@address`
it stikk wants a password root@192.168.1.7's password:
And if you enter root's password?
does it work?
log on as a normal user
the last manpage suggests to `touch /var/log/wtmp` if you get that error
hi.
I dont have the time to do in-depth stuff right now.
